titles: Thou shalt not fear God, and reverence my sanctuary. A sharp rebuke, or A rod for the enemies of common prayer, that wrote the book of unmasking it with lies; I also prove it to be the pure worship of God taken out of his word, his revealed will. By Thomas Hicks.
author: Hicks, Thomas, 17th cent.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
A reply to: The common prayer-book unmasked.
keywords: Church of England. --  Book of common prayer --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Common prayer-book unmasked --  Early works to 1800.
